module.p: -(e)as is a suffix used to create masculine derived common nouns from adjectives or other common nouns.

De-adjectival examples –
ceart right, just ⇒ ceartas justice
dual
birthright, inheritance ⇒ dualach adj. inherent, innate ⇒ dualchas
tradition, heritage
mì-cheart unjust ⇒ mì-cheartas injustice
mì-choltach improbable ⇒ mì-choltas improbability
mì-shona unhappy ⇒ mì-shonas unhappiness
mì-thorrach infertile ⇒ mì-thorrachas infertility

De-nominal examples –
aintighearna despot, tyrant ⇒ aintighearnas despotism, tyranny
aineol stranger, strangeness ⇒ aineolas ignorance
beairt
engine, (hand) loom, contrivance, instrument ⇒ beairteas
wealth, riches, affluence
caraid friend ⇒ càirdeas friendship
earail caution, encouragement ⇒ earalas caution, cautiousness
